name: Hyatt Regency DFW

reviews.text: Three minute shuttle ride from baggage claim since it's "on campus." Modern/Clean Hyatt rooms. Really quiet for being at the airport. Shuttle back to airport ran every 20 mins. like clockwork.
reviews.title: Perfect for layover

reviews.text: Our group stayed here for a conference, and it was ok. The rooms are newly re-done with a clean modern look. There is a charge for internet access, and it took me three attempts to get some laundry picked up. But the customer service was good- they paid for my laundry since it was their fault it never got picked up. The bad part was getting a taxi or car for getting around. It is a baseline charge of 23$ (!) to get a taxi anywhere; this is due to some rules aobut the hotel being on airport property. We all wished we had rented a car, but the hotel charges 25$/day to keep it there. The hotel restaurants are ok, but we headed out for dinner most times which usually meant at least a 15min drive somewhere. Again, the hotel itself is nice. There is no spa here.
reviews.title: GOOD ROOMS, TRANSPORTATION EXPENSIVE

reviews.text: Great location at the airport if you want an in and out experience with no hassel. The shuttle comes every 10 minutes or so, and the driver was very friendly. Room service menu was pretty limiting, and VERY pricey. However, if you do room service, you must try the ice cream sundae - very delicious!! The rooms are pretty basic, and could use a reburbishment, but nice overall. They also have tiny little balconies which is good for us smokers.
reviews.title: Very convenient for airport travel
awesome
reviews.text: it was smooth . the price was great and it worked great for being close to where we were flying out of

Stayed from 12 to 18 July 2009 for business. It is located within DFW Airport property, so it is convenient for layovers. C Terminal is the closest and there is a semi-direct walking path between C Terminal and the hotel. This path requires going up and down at least 4 flights of stairs. It does not appear to be wheelchair accessible.
reviews.title: Good value and location for DFW Airport (but not Dallas, TX)

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night, it was great. It was great location, there was plenty to do inside hotel and close by. I would stay there again if I went back. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Regency DFW. The staff was courteous the room was recently renovated. Check in was a smooth transaction. The room was clean (passed the hair test). Attended the Dallas Cowboy game and after the lost it was a pleasure to return to the room and relax. I would recommend and plan to stay again when we return. Thanks Hyatt!
reviews.title: Nice Weekend

reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency is located close to Terminal C of DFW Airport. It went through a renovation a couple of years ago, so I was curious if the rooms lived up to the hype compared to a visit a 5 years ago.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but did not like it much, lousy breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, they do, to an extent. The rooms are indeed nicely decorated and look quite elegant. I did not feel very comfortable though, as the windows did not get a proper soundproofing, so the noise of the starting planes and the car traffic was to hear loud and clear.
reviews.title: BRAVO!!

reviews.text: In terms of room features I found irritating that the room did not seem to have a fridge. The bathroom also felt a bit spartanic.
reviews.title: Wow! with a few minor things....

reviews.text: I love this Hotel and stay here frequently (room photos on Hyatt are accurate (minus the plants in the room)). What set's this hotel apart?
reviews.title: Hearty Endorsement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1-Every room has a balcony. If you are an indoor worker, you appreciate getting "fresh" air on occasion. With balconies in every room, it is easy to open the door -though it can be noisy, and can be smelly (depends on the wind -Jet A fumes). If you like aviation though, these concerns are negated because this is an awesome place to watch aviation. Once you shut the door though, most sounds are cut off though you can hear the larger planes taking off with the door shut on occasion.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: 2 - Shower and bathroom -No tubs or shower curtains here (unless you do get one of the tub rooms). That is a huge difference if you are used to a shower at home. The bathroom is nice, large, and upscale. You will not get the cramped feeling. And the commode and sink area are separated by a door. A very nice bonus is the shower head.
reviews.title: Great property right at the airport

reviews.text: Other - rooms are sized right and are nicely decorated, though there are some cramped ones depending on where your room is. All rooms have ihome clock radios- a nice touch. Nice workspace - on the order of Marriott, but it is nice that the desk swivels out. There is also a big easy chair with ottoman - I know some Marriott rooms have sofa's but the easy chair is a nice place to sit- nicer than the chairs at Marriott. Workout facility is very nice. I am not an expert on work-out rooms though since I prefer to exercise outside (and this is a negative to this hotel since it is in the middle of the airport). However, there are multiple, high quality treadmills and other high quality equipment (stair climbers, bikes, and weight machines) in a very nice, comfortable facility with towels (available in a towel warmer), fruit and cold water. TV's (on different channels) line the walls and the equipment have built in TV's too.
reviews.title: Great Hyatt!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concerns -This is obviously a convention hotel. Conventions can make the hotel noisy and crowded, but if you aren't going to spend a lot of time in the public spaces, you will never notice it if you are in your room.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience at Hyatt Regency DFW

reviews.text: We won this Hotel through Priceline. We did have an idea we would be at DFW airport which we were fine with. Not bad location especially for the travelers. Very close to Ft. Worth and Grapevine. Hotel is very nice!. If you travel in/out of the hotel they will stamp your TOLL card so your fare is covered. Parking is free here. They only have a swimming pool outdoors with no hottub. Also room has no fridge/microwave. Fitness room has treadmills,bikes,weights,water, and cold towels.
reviews.title: Nice Place if looking for something by DFW.

reviews.text: We have had two banquets at the Hyatt Regency for our club. From the moment you pull up to the entrance to the moment you leave everyone makes you feel valued. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to hold a banquet or other event. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable as well.
reviews.title: Dedicated to customer service

reviews.text: Came here for a business conference in which I flew on a Monday night and flew out on a Wednesday night. Shuttle bus carries you from terminal to hotel.
reviews.title: Nice and quiet at the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: Frequent shuttle service from baggage claim whisks you to the entrance, where check-in in efficient. If line gets long, another clerk will start checking people in. Bank of six elevators, so there isn't much waiting to go up to your room.
reviews.title: A very convenient stopover hotel

reviews.text: Rooms are cozy and hotel is soundproofed so you don't hear the airport all day and night. Room was clean and bathroom sink is seperated from bath/toilet in case you have a roommate. Best part was the bed, which was extremely comfortable. Was out like a light as soon as my head touched the pillow!
reviews.title: Not bad but would have rather stayed in town

reviews.text: After missing a connection American put me up in this hotel. Not to be confused with the Grand Hyatt, this is the older Hyatt in terminal C. What a pleasant surprise this was. The property has undergone a total remodel and is way bettter than expected. The rooms have a "W" hotel feel, huge flat screen TVs, new comfy beds and the decor is first rate. The only drawback to the property is that it is quite a walk from the terminal, although they do have a shuttle. I would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise

reviews.text: My most recent stay at Hyatt Regency, DFW was the best stay I have had there. Like all other times, this stay was so I could catch an early flight the next morning. Being on the airport premises, it takes very few minutes for the hotel shuttle to arrive at the gate.
reviews.title: Ideal for over night and early flights

likes.liked: — size of room and freinndly staff

reviews.text: When making reservations, I paid the rate for a normal "King", but when checking in, I was told that I had been upgraded to a King Deluxe; thus I was Suprised at the size of the room when entering it. the room has a 7 ft. couch and the bed had 5 or 6 pillows on it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms are great. Comfortable. convenient.

reviews.text: Likewise, the bathroom was large. It does not have a tub, but a shower only. the shower stall is the length of a tub and has a stabble plexiglass wall half the length of a tub.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but you will hear some airport noise

likes.liked: — Easy access from airport and nice bed.

reviews.text: This hotel has a restroom on the patio beside the pool which is very convenant for the guest.
reviews.title: A Good Hyatt

likes.disliked: — Listening to the planes take off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for my wife's high school reunion, and had a wonderful time! We were a little surprised to find out that the hotel where the reunion was being held was actually at DFW, but once we got to the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great hotel - much better than you would expect to find at an airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great service started with the valet, who kept our car for 20-30 minutes with no charge (valet is normally $25 per day) while we checked in and quickly cleaned up before going out. He also pointed out that, while he would love to park our car for us, there was free parking in the garage, and he told us how to get there.
reviews.title: Early flight out? Don't waste your time elsewhere.

reviews.text: The line at check-in happened to be long when we drove in, but that was because there had been a bad storm the day before, and there were about 50 flights that were canceled, so people were scrambling to find a room. The long line was not a problem, though, as the efficient front desk staff moved very quickly and handled us in short order.
reviews.title: Great hotel at DFW Airport

reviews.text: The bellman got us and our luggage up to our room very quickly in the service elevator, since the guest elevators were completely overwhelmed right then. That is one downside to the hotel - apparently it's very popular with conventions, and there was a large teen convention during the week, resulting in a long wait for the elevators until the group checked out early Saturday morning.
reviews.title: All in one
Wonderful staff
reviews.text: The room is very clean and must have been remodeled recently. The furnishings are all modern and sleek - very comfortable without being cold. The king bed was comfortable, and there is a work desk on wheels with a desk chair, a chair with ottoman, and another side chair. The TVs are 32" LCD, with a typical array of cable channels and PPV.
In general a good transit hotel for a one night stopover.
reviews.title: overnight stop at airport

reviews.text: Found the coach to the hotel and it was quite prompt,Portarage was good and explained my room setup,I had upgraded my room for extra $35 but i expected more,I had ordered some things for the room like beer as the flight was dry and i was gasping for some shiner bok,also extra pillows for 16-00pm that day.
reviews.title: Doubled charge for my stay !!!

reviews.text: The bar was good with good selections of draft beer and bottled european brands very good service and i had dinner at the bar which was also good,Breakfast had a good choice hot and cold for $15 so cant complain about the price
reviews.title: Convenient nice hotel

reviews.text: Outside pool was to cold to use for November but in general a good stopover hotel for the night.
reviews.title: Solid Hyatt property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is no good if you want to see the night life in Dallas or Fort/worth because of its 25 miles to each also the cost of a cab $75 to the stockyards for my next hotel also a hyatt i would say the hotel is overpriced for what i paid for the night even with upgrade $280
reviews.title: Excellent Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night, as we were coming in from out of town and flying home out of DFW early the next AM.
reviews.title: Convenient to Airport!

reviews.text: Rooms very spacious and clean. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Great choice by DFW airport

reviews.text: I did have a chance to use the fitness center and it was very clean, had good amount of equipment and plenty of clean towels.
reviews.title: Horrible Service! Parking is not free!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner and drinks in the lounge one night and the food was ok, typical bar food. BUT we had breakfast in the cafe in the AM, did the Breakfast buffett, and it was very good. Lot's of variety and good quality food w/ omelettes to order!
reviews.title: What a value for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went out on the town that night and the concierge hooked us up with some ideas and free passes and got us a cab there and back.
reviews.title: Stuck in DFW during the Blizzard

description: Be greeted by our welcoming staff any hour of the day – or night – at our outstanding DFW airport hotel offering the luxury of 24 hour check-in. Expect the best at Hyatt Regency DFW, where business is really a pleasure. Fly-in and fly-out of our contemporary Dallas Fort Worth airport hotel with 92,000 square feet of unequaled function space and a multilingual staff. Enjoy ultra-contemporary over-sized guestrooms and an exquisite zero-edge heated lap pool. Fresh from a $50 million renovation, our Dallas Ft Worth airport hotel is equally ideal for NASCAR and Dallas Cowboys fans, families heading to Six Flags® Over Texas, Historic Downtown Grapevine, or avid golfers looking for an award-winning round at Bear Creek Golf Club. A superb combination of impeccable service and outstanding amenities, Hyatt Regency DFW is the unparalleled choice for business, leisure or both.
